intro: Delosperma taylorii var. albanense, commonly known as the Albanian iceplant, is a low-growing, succulent plant native to southern Africa. It features fleshy, blue-green leaves that are adapted to store water, allowing it to thrive in arid environments. The plant produces clusters of small, star-shaped flowers in shades of pink to purple, typically during the cooler months. It is a member of the Aizoaceae family, known for its ability to tolerate drought and poor soil conditions. This variant is distinguished by its unique leaf coloration and floral display, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
